meanings.definition: Have an intense feeling of longing for something, typically something that one has lost or been separated from.
meanings.sent1: She would yearn for her childhood home every time she saw a picture of it.
meanings.sent2: I yearn for the days when we could all gather together without any worries.
meanings.sent3: He would yearn for his favorite toy that he lost, even though he had many others to play with.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, she would yearn for the warmth of her mother's embrace.
meanings.sent5: The old man would yearn for the sound of laughter echoing through the halls of his youth.

meanings.definition: Feel a strong desire or craving for something.
meanings.sent1: The smell of freshly baked cookies made him yearn for a sweet treat.
meanings.sent2: I yearn for adventure and new experiences in far-off lands.
meanings.sent3: She would yearn for a slice of cake, even though she had just finished a big meal.
meanings.sent4: His heart would yearn for the freedom of the open road, away from the city's hustle and bustle.
meanings.sent5: The young girl would yearn for the chance to explore the mysterious forest beyond her village.
